instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: macbook air Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B FA turning on issue
threads.message: Hello, I have Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board, which looks like new, no water damage. But sometimes refuses to turn on. But if turned, fully works. Thanks for advices.

threads.title: macbook air Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B FA turning on issue
threads.message: Disconnected everything and just connected power? Checked PPBUS?

threads.title: macbook air Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B FA turning on issue
threads.message: everything disconnected, only charger, green light goes to orange and cooler don't start spinning. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8.6v, <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is 3.4v. short to ground <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> but nothing happens.

threads.title: macbook air Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B FA turning on issue
threads.message: If there is no liquid present then this one is going to suck. Sometimes there is corrosion around <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> and the traces to Y1905. Intermittent issue are pretty hopeless

threads.title: macbook air Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B FA turning on issue
threads.message: could we discuss what voltages should be present to get MacBook turned on?

threads.title: macbook air Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B FA turning on issue
threads.message: What good will that do? It turns on sometimes so finding such an intermittent issue is a nightmare. I gave you something to check. If that is ok then it can be anything and probably going to be a no fix.

threads.title: macbook air Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B FA turning on issue
threads.message:
OK, throw this away.

have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no water, clean as new. battery chargers, but no way to turn it on. if connect only charger green light changes to orange and thats it.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.6v

<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> 3.4v

what voltages should I check next? what further steps. thank you

threads.title: macbook air Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B FA turning on issue
threads.message: Try connecting a known good battery and see if it powers on and stays on. If not, then trash this.

threads.title: macbook air Logic Board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B FA turning on issue
threads.message: Actually completely disregard my comment thought this was a 00165. I'm with Duke this is a time waster.
